intro: Bossekia nutkana, commonly known as the Nutkanan bossekia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Bossekia nutkana is known for its drought tolerance and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
